inclusion.criterion: Pregnant women at least 18 years of age
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Women undergoing a non-emergent cesarean delivery
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Spinal anesthesia or combined spinal-epidural anesthesia utilized during cesarean
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Ability to undergo the informed consent process in English
inclusion.label: met

exclusion.criterion: History of major depression or postpartum depression requiring medication
exclusion.label: unknown

exclusion.criterion: Chronic opiate use during pregnancy, defined as anyone who has taken an opioid or opioid replacement therapy in the 3 days prior to admission for delivery. This does not include opioids given for labor anesthesia.
exclusion.label: not_met

exclusion.criterion: Preexisting fibromyalgia, chronic pain syndrome, or rheumatologic disorder
exclusion.label: unknown

notes: Patient is a pregnant woman at 32+6 weeks of gestational age undergoing non-emergent cesarean delivery. She has no history of major depression or postpartum depression requiring medication, but her family history is positive for DM type 2 and HTN.
